RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 1 7 1/2F Turf CR: 79. Claiming Purse 21000. FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD OR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since July 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000 (Claiming races for $17,500 o r less not considered in estimating allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LORRAINE'S LEGACY was sent to the front, set a pressured pace to the second turn, drew clear entering the stretch, was under pressure late and held under urging. SPIRITCATCHER broke out and was rated back at the start, was never far off the pace, rallied along the inside on the second turn, shifted out at the top of the stretch, closed steadily and gained late to narrow the gap. BLUE NEITH pressed the pace while racing two across to the second turn, fell back, went evenly late and held for show. NIFF was crowded at the start, stalked the pace, rallied four wide on the second turn, was within range and failed to rally. MAIDEN ROCK was never far back, saved ground, was crowded entering the far turn and lacked the needed late response.

ENTRY.NAME: Blue Neith
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 2across to 2nd turn, fell back, evenly late, held show

ENTRY.NAME: Maiden Rock
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, crowded into 2nd turn, lacked late response,

ENTRY.NAME: Spiritcatcher
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out, rated, bid inside 2nd turn, steady close, late gain,

ENTRY.NAME: Niff
ENTRY.COMMENT: crowded start, stalked pace, rallied 4wide 2nd turn, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Lorraine's Legacy
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, drew clear 2nd turn, held well, under urging

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 80. Allowance Purse 39000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since July 24 A llowed 2 lbs. (Claiming races for $20,000 or less not considered in estimating allowances) (Preference by condition eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RIBBONSINHERHAIR pressed the pace, challenged two across on the turn, dueled through the stretch and prevailed in a game effort. I DON'T KNOW MARGO set the pace to the turn, dueled through the stretch and was outnodded to just miss. VISIONISTA stalked the pace while racing inside, got through along the rail on the turn and battled for show. STYLE was never far off the pace, rallied five wide on the turn, bid willingly and didn't have enough late. SECRET OPERATION broke out, angled out on the turn, bid between horses to get within range and lacked the needed late response. EVERYTHING'S ROSY was off a step slowly, saved ground and failed to respond.

ENTRY.NAME: Everything's Rosy
ENTRY.COMMENT: off a step slowly, saved ground, failed to respond,

ENTRY.NAME: Secret Operation
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out, angled out turn, bid between horses, lacked a rally

ENTRY.NAME: Visionista
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, got through rail turn, battled for show

ENTRY.NAME: Ribbonsinherhair
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, challenged 2across turn, dueled stretch, prevailed,

ENTRY.NAME: I Don't Know Margo
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace to turn, dueled stretch, outnodded, just missed,

ENTRY.NAME: Style
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, rallied 5wide turn, bid willingly, not enough

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 3 1M Turf CR: 88. Allowance Purse 39000. FOR ILLINOIS REGISTERED, CONCEIVED AND/OR FOALED. Three Year Olds and Upward Which Have Not Won A State Bred Race Other Than Maiden, Claiming, Or Starter or Which Have Never Won Two Races. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race a t a mile or over on the turf since July 24 Allowed 2 lbs. (Claiming races for $20,000 or less not considered in estimating allowances) (Preference by condition eligibility). In the event that this race is taken off the turf it will be contested at One Mil e and Seventy Yards on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAN ON ATTACK was pushed in at the start while getting away well, set a pressured pace to the second turn, drew clear and held safely while kept to task. TAHOE RUN settled off the pace, rallied on the turn, swung wide entering the stretch, closed well and got up late for place while no threat to the winner. KINGSBURRY ATTACK broke in, vied between horses, fell back into the second turn, came again along the rail, shifted out for the drive, bid willingly and was caught for second. DASTARDLY DEEDS was unhurried early, saved ground, bid off the rail, was in tight and bumped late and leveled off. COOL AND COLLECTED pressed the pace three across, challenged for the lead on the turn, fell back, was in tight and bumped late and fell further behind.

ENTRY.NAME: Man On Attack
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace to 2nd turn, drew clear, kept to task

ENTRY.NAME: Kingsburry Attack
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in, vied between, fell back, came again inside, caught 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Cool and Collected
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 3across,challenged turn, fell back, in tight, bumped late

ENTRY.NAME: Tahoe Run
ENTRY.OWNER: Robertson Hugh H Mentz John and Larson Jeff
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off pace, rallied turn, swung wide, up late for place

ENTRY.NAME: Dastardly Deeds
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, saved ground, bid off rail, in tight, bumped late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 4 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 15000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE FEBRUARY 24, 2023. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race at a mile or over since July 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Claimi ng Price $6,250 (Claiming races for $4,000 or less not considered in estimating allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NO NANNETTE NO raced close to the pace along the inside, bid along the rail leaving the turn, dueled for the lead and inched clear late. EMITYAAZ vied inside, inched away, responded when challenged to duel and yielded late to finish second best. MARIA'S GIFT lagged early, raced outside, rallied around the turn, bid six wide and closed well to earn show. C C'S WORLD raced close to the pace, rallied three wide on the turn to challenge for the lead, fell back and came up empty late. SHADOW BELLE was unhurried early, advanced on the turn, bid five wide and had nothing left. HARD LIKE HOLLY went four wide on the first turn, vied two across, stopped, was eased and walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: No Nannette No
ENTRY.COMMENT: close to pace inside, bid rail turn, dueled, clear late, best

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Russell De Petrillo Sr. & L. Jerry Johnson

ENTRY.NAME: Maria's Gift
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged early, raced outside, rallied turn, 6wide bid, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Emityaaz
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied inside, inched clear, responded to duel, yielded late

ENTRY.NAME: C C's World
ENTRY.COMMENT: close to pace, rallied 3wide turn, challenged, fell back, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Hard Like Holly
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4wide 1st turn, vied 2across, stopped turn, eased, walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Shadow Belle
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, advanced turn, 5wide bid, nothing left

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 5 1M Turf CR: 88. Allowance Purse 39000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race at a mile or ov er since July 24 Allowed 2 lbs. (Claiming races for $20,000 or less not considered in estimating allowances) (Preference by condition eligibility). In the event that this race is taken off the turf it will be contested at One Mile and Seventy Yards on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PRANCIPANTS raced close to the pace along the inside, awaited room on the turn, shifted out at the top of the stretch, closed willingly and wore down her rivals to get up in the final strides. R KATIEBUG veered in at the start while getting away well, set a pressured pace to the final strides and was outfinished in a good effort. WANDA STRONG raced mid pack, angled out on the turn, bid seven wide and finished well to get up at the wire for show. PENUMBRAS MAKER was hard to load, pressed the pace, rallied three wide on the turn to challenge, hung late and was caught for third. JUDY'S MS. OFFICER was taken off the rail on the backstretch, went eight wide leaving the turn and finished well. SAKE (FR) was slow early, advanced to the turn, bid nine wide and closed well. I'M BOX OFFICE was crowded at the start, rated back, saved ground and failed to menace in an even effort. SALLY'S SUPRISE was sent to the front, vied to the second turn and flattened out. LUNA MOTH broke slowly and was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: I'm Box Office
ENTRY.COMMENT: crowded start, rated back, saved ground, even effort

ENTRY.NAME: R Katiebug
ENTRY.OWNER: Cherrywood Racing Stables II and Oak Rock Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered in while away well, set pressured pace to final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Judy's Ms. Officer
ENTRY.OWNER: Reavis, Michael L. and Fraterrigo, Gregory J.
ENTRY.COMMENT: taken off rail backstretch, 8wide leaving turn, finished well,

ENTRY.NAME: Prancipants
ENTRY.COMMENT: awaited room turn, shifted out, closed, wore down rivals, up late

ENTRY.NAME: Sake (FR)
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, advanced to turn, 9wide bid, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Sally's Suprise
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent to front, vied to 2nd turn, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Penumbras Maker
ENTRY.COMMENT: hard to load, pressed pace, challenged turn, hung late

ENTRY.NAME: Wanda Strong
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, angled out 2nd turn, 7wide bid, finished well, up show

ENTRY.NAME: Luna Moth
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke slowly, no factor, outrun,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 69. Allowance Purse 39000. FOR ILLINOIS REGISTERED, CONCEIVED AND/OR FOALED. Fillies And Mares Three Years Old and Upward Which Have Not Won A State Bred Race Other Than Maiden, Claiming, Or Starter or Which Have Never Won Two Races. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non- winners of a race since July 24 Allowed 2 lbs. (Claiming races for $20,000 or less not considered in estimating allowances) (Preference by condition eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MADELYN BELLE set the pace and held well in a driving finish. COMMISSIONER GULCH bumped lightly at the start, pressed the pace along the inside, shifted out for the drive, went willingly to the wire, couldn't gain and finished second best. LOVEYOULIKECRAZY was a bit fractious in the gate, pressed the pace, fell back leaving the turn, went evenly late and held safely for show. RANK AND FILE was never far back, raced outside, went five wide leaving the turn, lacked a bid and faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Madelyn Belle
ENTRY.OWNER: Catalano Thoroughbreds Inc and LAZ Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, held well, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Loveyoulikecrazy
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious in gate, pressed to turn, fell back, even finish

ENTRY.NAME: Commissioner Gulch
ENTRY.OWNER: Ritter Charles W and Becker Scott
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start,pressed inside,shifted out, willingly, couldn't gain

ENTRY.NAME: Rank and File
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, raced outside, 5wide into stretch, no bid

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 7 1M Turf CR: 77. Maiden Special Weight Purse 38000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Preference by condition eligibility). In the event that this race is taken off the turf it will be contested at One Mile and Seventy Yards on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FIRST HILL raced close to the pace, rallied around the turn, assumed command in the upper stretch and drew clear. APPLE EVER AFTER broke out, vied around the first turn, fell back, stayed close, came again in traffic and was gaining late. THEMISCHIEVOUSONE was slow early, advanced inside on the turn, closed willingly, was impeded mid stretch, surged late and was gaining ground. GOLD OAK vied to the second turn, fell back, continued willingly and came up empty late. TOUR DE' PORT was crowded at the start, void of early speed, advanced on the turn, closed in traffic and was gaining late. BONITA D'ORO raced mid pack, saved ground, bid inside and had little left. MISS HIGH N MIGHTY was checked hard at the start, rushed up outside to vie, drew clear on the turn and weakened in the drive. BROADWAY CHARM was outrun in an even effort. SILVER EYES raced mid pack, had nothing left for the drive and lacked a bid. GETOUTOFMYKITCHEN lost her footing at the start to be off slowly and was always outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: First Hill
ENTRY.COMMENT: close to pace, rallied turn, took over upper stretch, drew clear,

ENTRY.NAME: Apple Ever After
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out, vied around 1st turn, stayed close, came again,gaining

ENTRY.NAME: Gold Oak
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied to 2nd turn, fell back, continued willingly, empty late

ENTRY.NAME: Bonita d'Oro
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, saved ground, bid inside, little left

ENTRY.NAME: Tour De' Port
ENTRY.COMMENT: crowded start, void early speed, closed in traffic, gaining,

ENTRY.NAME: Broadway Charm
ENTRY.COMMENT: even effort, no factor, outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Silver Eyes
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, nothing left for drive, lacked a bid

ENTRY.NAME: Getoutofmykitchen
ENTRY.COMMENT: lost footing, off slowly, always outrun, showed little,

ENTRY.NAME: Themischievousone
ENTRY.COMMENT: advanced inside turn, closed, impeded mid stretch, late surge

ENTRY.NAME: Miss High N Mighty
ENTRY.COMMENT: checked hard start, rushed up outside, drew clear turn, weakened,
